page.title: 01The Village of Lockerley
page.content: The overall impression of the village of Lockerley is that it is a very scattered community with two main centres of population separated by nearly a mile of countryside. The Church stands between these two centres acting as a kind of bridge, and with its spire is clearly visible from the two ends of the village; it helps unite a widespread population of about 900 people. Lockerley is made up of at least four greens, with houses grouped around three of them. At Butts Green we have the village institutions - the school, the village hall, telephone exchange and the pub. Lockerley Green is the commercial centre of the village with Post Office, shop and garage. Top Green is, as the name implies, on a small hill and is a circle of houses. Critchells Green is less inhabited.
